item.title: The teen mental health crisis mystery
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. css-y2oq5g{display:-webkit-inline-box;display:-webkit-inline-flex;display:-ms-inline-flexbox;display:inline-flex;-webkit-appearance:none;-moz-appearance:none;-ms-appearance:none;appearance:none;-webkit-align-items:center;-webkit-box-align:center;-ms-flex-align:center;align-items:center;-webkit-box-pack:center;-ms-flex-pack:center;-webkit-justify-content:center;justify-content:center;-webkit-user-select:none;-moz-user-select:none;-ms-user-select:none;user-select:none;position:relative;white-space:nowrap;vertical-align:middle;outline:2px solid transparent;outline-offset:2px;width:auto;line-height:1.2;border-radius:var(--chakra-radii-md);font-weight:var(--chakra-fontWeights-semibold);transition-property:var(--chakra-transition-property-common);transition-duration:var(--chakra-transition-duration-normal);height:var(--chakra-sizes-10);min-width:var(--chakra-sizes-10);font-size:var(--chakra-fontSizes-md);-webkit-padding-start:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-start:var(--chakra-space-4);-webkit-padding-end:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-end:var(--chakra-space-4);color:var(--chakra-colors-white);background:var(--colors-primary);radius:var(--border-radius);}. First, the stats: Between 2009 and 2021, the share of American high school students who said they feel ‚Äúpersistent feelings of sadness or hopelessness‚Äù jumped from 26% to a record 44%, per a new CDC study. Much criticism has been heaped upon social media companies for creating the teen mental health crisis.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. But it‚Äôs not: Every single one of the ~175,000 U-Haul rental trucks in the US and Canada sport Arizona license plates. Quote: ‚ÄúWe did not see a massive influx of retail investors into crypto after the Super Bowl ads.‚Äù (Zebra Zone) Watch: Why are TV cameras still huge and expensive? Noelle Acheson, head of market insights at digital asset broker Genesis Trading, told the FT that crypto trading remained quiet in the weeks following the crypto-ad blitz at the Super Bowl.

item.title: Shanghai authorities have erected fences around residential buildings in the locked-down city
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. üá∫üá¶üá∫üá∏ The US sent a high-level delegation to Ukraine: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken and Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin met with Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelensky in Kyiv yesterday, according to a Ukrainian official. The protest song ‚ÄúDo You Hear The People Sing?‚Äù css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! Shanghai authorities were seen erecting green fences around residential areas in an apparent attempt to keep people in the locked-down city from leaving their homes. css-y2oq5g[data-disabled]{opacity:0.5;cursor:not-allowed;box-shadow:var(--chakra-shadows-none);}. They‚Äôre the most senior-ranking US officials to visit the city since Russia‚Äôs invasion, though many top European leaders have already been to Kyiv to talk with Zelensky. css-1dlcpt7[data-disabled]{opacity:0.4;background-color:rgba(0,0,0,. Apparently Musk‚Äôs ability to come up with $46.5 billion in financing changed leadership‚Äôs thinking from vehemently opposed to ‚ÄúOK, maybe we should negotiate.‚Äù Twitter is reevaluating Elon Musk‚Äôs bid to buy the company for $43 billion, the WSJ reported.

Buffett rented this 3,300-square-foot home in the Dundee neighborhood in the 1950s for just $175 a month.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: NYC's salary transparency law faces pushback from businesses
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeNew York City‚Äôs monumental pay transparency law is set to take effect on May 15, meaning that nearly every company operating in the city will have to include a pay range for all open job listings. Critics of the amendment said these employees‚Äîincluding those in the food services and retail industries‚Äîare some of the city‚Äôs most marginalized workers who are most in need of pay transparency. During testimony over the amendment, some small-business advocates also claimed the law would allow larger companies to easily outbid them for talented hires. While the law is still set to go into effect on May 15, the amended bill is currently in committee. But a proposed amendment to the law‚Äîsupported by large business groups and under consideration by the city council‚Äîcould limit its scope, create room for loopholes, and delay its implementation until November. ‚ÄîMK css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! In a letter to the City Council, the Partnership for New York City (a powerful business group) criticized it for lacking input from the employers it would affect. But radical transparency has proven effective at addressing the wage gap and giving employees an idea of what their work is worth. In the original wording of the amendment, businesses with 15 or fewer employees would be exempt‚Äîa change that would have removed around 58,000 NYC companies and 500,000 employees from the scope of the law. That‚Äôs a big deal, as pay transparency laws exist largely to address racial and gender pay gaps.
item.author: Max Knoblauch

Something old, something new, something borrowed‚Ä¶Dennis from finance? Anything nagging at you? css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none!
item.author: Shane Loughnane

item.title: Icebreakers with‚Ä¶Pachinko creator Soo Hugh
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. You know, one of the things we say is that all Asians are not monoliths, right? css-y2oq5g{display:-webkit-inline-box;display:-webkit-inline-flex;display:-ms-inline-flexbox;display:inline-flex;-webkit-appearance:none;-moz-appearance:none;-ms-appearance:none;appearance:none;-webkit-align-items:center;-webkit-box-align:center;-ms-flex-align:center;align-items:center;-webkit-box-pack:center;-ms-flex-pack:center;-webkit-justify-content:center;justify-content:center;-webkit-user-select:none;-moz-user-select:none;-ms-user-select:none;user-select:none;position:relative;white-space:nowrap;vertical-align:middle;outline:2px solid transparent;outline-offset:2px;width:auto;line-height:1.2;border-radius:var(--chakra-radii-md);font-weight:var(--chakra-fontWeights-semibold);transition-property:var(--chakra-transition-property-common);transition-duration:var(--chakra-transition-duration-normal);height:var(--chakra-sizes-10);min-width:var(--chakra-sizes-10);font-size:var(--chakra-fontSizes-md);-webkit-padding-start:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-start:var(--chakra-space-4);-webkit-padding-end:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-end:var(--chakra-space-4);color:var(--chakra-colors-white);background:var(--colors-primary);radius:var(--border-radius);}. I think it‚Äôs important to try to represent the original character as much as possible. I think you couldn‚Äôt have done the show without that. So, like, I‚Äôm Korean. Let me try out the show in Korean. And if I don‚Äôt like it, I could just click away.‚Äù Most of Pachinko‚Äôs main cast is of Korean descent. What‚Äôs so interesting is that you realize all around the world, they‚Äôve been watching American content in subtitles for so long now.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: The most powerful particle accelerator is back online
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. The Large Hadron Collider‚Äîwhich is 20 miles long and nestled about 300 feet beneath the Alps‚Äîuses colder-than-outer-space magnets (colder = more magnetic) to accelerate particles close to the speed of light. What‚Äôs revealed by the Large Hadron Collider could confirm the Standard Model, or pave the way for a new ‚Äútheory of everything.‚Äù ‚ÄîJW And what exactly is that job? css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none!
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Snapchat‚Äôs user growth lapped other social media platforms
item.description: . Snap reported that 250 million users use its AR functions every day. Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. The platform is also still reeling from Apple‚Äôs 2021 privacy update that limits ad tracking on iPhones. ‚ÄîMM It‚Äôs captured Gen Z hearts and downloads. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeSnap, the parent company of Snapchat, released its Q1 earnings on Thursday and, while it just narrowly missed revenue targets, its daily-active-user growth is lapping Facebook and Twitter. It has 90% adoption for users aged 13‚Äì24 in the US, UK, and the Netherlands.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: American Express sees faster-than-expected business travel growth
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. It gets weirder: The Moonbirds team doesn‚Äôt seem to know if Fallon actually bought the NFT, or if it was a gift. css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}Subscribeüõ©Ô∏è Is business travel back? ü¶â Where did Fallon get that owl? Still, the broader travel rebound has been fueled not by companies, but by individuals: US consumers in AmEx‚Äôs network spent 120% more on travel in Q1 than in the same period in 2019. Travel spend in March by S&P 500 clients was ‚Äúwell over over 50%‚Äù of its level in 2019, which execs hailed as a big win. It tees up a potential investigation of Twitter over free-speech restrictions if Republicans were to win a majority in the House this November. House Republicans demanded that Twitter preserve all materials linked to Elon Musk‚Äôs bid to buy the company, calling the board‚Äôs opposition to the takeover offer ‚Äúconcerning.‚Äù
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Why Germany can‚Äôt quit Russian gas
item.description: . css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeSince the beginning of the war in Ukraine, the EU has paid more than $37 billion for Russian energy supplies‚Äîa big chunk of that by the bloc‚Äôs No. 1 economy, Germany. Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Instead of Germany‚Äôs economy growing by 3% this year, it would shrink by 2%, amounting to one of the worst recessions in the country since the financial crisis. As a result, cutting off Russian gas would force some of Germany‚Äôs industrial production to shut down and put an estimated 400,000+ people out of work. ‚ÄîNF German businesses would face their ‚Äúworst crisis since the Second World War‚Äù if a gas embargo were put into effect, Martin Bruderm√ºller, the CEO of chemicals giant BASF, warned. ‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt have an alternative energy source.‚Äù Big picture: With an immediate gas embargo seemingly off the table, Europe is trying to get creative to reduce its consumption of Russian energy. But since then, Germany has become even more dependent on Russian gas; as it wound down other power sources, such as nuclear and coal, it didn‚Äôt build up enough alternatives to replace them.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Icebreakers with‚Ä¶Pachinko showrunner Soo Hugh

item.title: Why Germany can‚Äôt quit Russian gas
item.description: . css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeSince the beginning of the war in Ukraine, the EU has paid more than $37 billion for Russian energy supplies‚Äîa big chunk of that by the bloc‚Äôs No. 1 economy, Germany. Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. That toll: The country‚Äôs central bank reported yesterday that an embargo on Russian gas would plunge it into a recession; Instead of Germany‚Äôs economy growing by 3% this year, it would shrink by 2%, amounting to one of the worst recessions in the country since the financial crisis. As a result, cutting off Russian gas would force some of Germany‚Äôs industrial production to shut down and put an estimated 400,000+ people out of work. ‚ÄîNF ‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt have an alternative energy source.‚Äù German businesses would face their ‚Äúworst crisis since the Second World War‚Äù if a gas embargo were put into effect, the CEO Martin Bruderm√ºller of chemicals giant BASF warned. Big picture: With an immediate gas embargo seemingly off the table, Europe is trying to get creative to reduce its consumption of Russian energy. But since then, Germany has become even more dependent on Russian gas as it wound down other power sources, such as nuclear and coal, but didn‚Äôt build up enough alternatives to replace them.

item.title: Study: US air pollution levels have risen sharply
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. And, according to the study, people of color are disproportionately affected by that pollution: They are nearly four times more likely than white people to live in a county with poor air quality. The annual State of the Air report found that 63 million people lived in counties exposed to dangerous levels of deadly particulate matter pollution this year‚Äî9 million more people than the previous year. ‚ÄîMK css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeAfter a nearly two-decadelong decline, US pollution levels have risen sharply over the past five years, according to a new report by the American Lung Association. In fact, more than 137 million Americans live in areas with poor air quality.
item.author: Max Knoblauch

item.title: CNN+ shuts down less than a month after launch
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. After pulling the plug, he will likely bundle all of the company‚Äôs video offerings, including Discovery+ and HBO Max, into one app. Big picture: David Zaslav, the former CEO of Discovery and new boss of the post-merged Warner Bros.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: All eyes on the remaining Mariupol holdouts at the Azovstal plant
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. The stories would have revealed that Kotick‚Äôs former girlfriend filed a temporary restraining order against him, but a team of Facebook and Activision employees strategized to quash the reporting, according to WSJ. css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! He‚Äôs putting up $21 billion of his own money. More than $25.5 billion of that comes through debt financing via Morgan Stanley Senior Funding and other partners. In a securities filing, Musk said he‚Äôs received $46.5 billion in commitments to help finance a potential tender offer to buy Twitter (he offered $43 billion). ü§ë Elon Musk says he‚Äôs got funding secured. Meta denies any wrongdoing by Sandberg. üíª Sheryl Sandberg allegedly leaned on reporters.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Florida legislature passes bill to revoke Disney World‚Äôs special tax district
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Considering there was no political discussion around Disney World‚Äôs special tax status until very recently, the move is widely seen as retaliation for Disney‚Äôs criticism of a Florida law that restricts discussion of gender identity and sexual orientation in some classrooms. Under the deal it worked out with Florida, Disney is allowed to build new structures without local approval and is exempted from certain environmental and wastewater codes. Disney‚Äôs been operating the special administrative zone, called the Reedy Creek Improvement District, for 55 years. David Ramba, executive director of the Florida Association of Special Districts, told CNBC that he hasn‚Äôt seen any special districts get dissolved that didn‚Äôt want to be dissolved, not to mention one run by a $222 billion corporation. ‚ÄîNF css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none!
item.author: Neal Freyman

Discovery said yesterday it‚Äôs shutting down the roughly three-week-old streaming service, CNN+.

The annual State of the Air report found that 63 million people lived in counties exposed to dangerous levels of deadly particulate matter pollution this year‚Äî9 million more people than the previous year. ‚ÄîMK css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeAfter a nearly two-decadelong decline, US pollution levels have risen sharply over the past five years, according to a new report by the American Lung Association. In fact, more than 137 million Americans live in areas with poor air quality.

item.title: Florida legislature passes bill to revoke Disney World‚Äôs special tax district
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Considering there was no political discussion around Disney World‚Äôs special tax status until very recently, the move is widely seen as retaliation for Disney‚Äôs criticism of a Florida law that restricts discussion of gender identity and sexual orientation in some classrooms. Under the deal it worked out with Florida, Disney is allowed to build new structures without local approval and is exempted from certain environmental and wastewater codes. Disney‚Äôs been operating the special administrative zone, called the Reedy Creek Improvement District, for 55 years. David Ramba, executive director of the Florida Association of Special Districts, told CNBC that he hasn‚Äôt seen any special districts get dissolved that didn‚Äôt want to be dissolved, not to mention one run by a $222 billion corporation. ‚ÄîNF css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none!
